benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to account

covered: Valid Request: TC01–TC04 cover successful PUT with required/optional headers and persistence.
Account with no existing fields: TC03 covers creation of custom fields (204).
Empty array: TC15 removes all custom fields (204).
Max field values/lengths: TC16 covers boundary values (204).
Input validation and errors: TC06, TC07, TC08, TC09, TC10, TC11 cover invalid accountId, non-existent account, missing header, missing body, malformed JSON, and invalid CustomField schema (400).
Large payload handling: TC04 with 100 items and TC26 exploring near-limit/over-limit behavior (204/413).
Security checks: TC20 (SQL injection) and TC21 (XSS).
Data integrity and compatibility: TC23 (duplicate field names) and TC24 (backward compatibility).
Performance and reliability: TC25 (concurrency) and TC22 (transient network recovery).
Integration and observability: TC27 (audit logs) and TC28 (external reporting).
Accessibility: TC29 ensures docs and errors are accessible.
gaps: Explicit 404 Not Found handling for non-existent account/资源 not tested (tests use 400).
403 Forbidden scenarios are not tested (only 401 is covered).
Partial update semantics beyond invalid-input handling are not clearly tested (whether partial updates are allowed).
recommendations: Add rate-limiting and throttling tests to verify system behavior under high request load.
Add validation of caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) and cache invalidation behavior.
Add tests for 404 Not Found and 403 Forbidden responses to broaden authorization/resource handling coverage.
Clarify and test partial update semantics: if partial PUT is allowed, implement and test; otherwise ensure invalid partial input yields 400 with detailed error messages.
